document_data.name: Kia al-Sadid
document_data.nicknames: Humble Servant of the Enlightened Gods
document_data.mainbody: Caliph '''Kia al-Sadid''', also called the '''Humble Servant of the Enlightened Gods''', was the ruler of [[Talab]] in the [[Pantheist League]] of [[interior Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Description: Mousy and slouching, Kia's physical appearance masked the power he wielded in Talab.
document_data.Personality: Though soft-spoken, his words held great wisdom.
document_data.Activities: Kia was installed by the [[League Conclave]] as the interim caliph of Talab following the assassination of his predecessor. He proved to be a capable administrator, and while he was not often seen in public his decrees were felt throughout the city.
